title: bcftools
description: Filter the variants called by freebayes or cellSNP

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

vcf.description: Type: List of `file`, required, multiple_sep: `";"`. VCF files, must have the same sample columns appearing in the same order
vcf.help_text: Type: List of `file`, required, multiple_sep: `";"`. VCF files, must have the same sample columns appearing in the same order.

concat.description: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. Concatenate or combine VCFs and sort them
concat.help_text: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. Concatenate or combine VCFs and sort them.

filter_qual.description: Type: `integer`, default: `30`. Filter VCFs with specified QUAL threshold
filter_qual.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `30`. Filter VCFs with specified QUAL threshold.

output.description: Type: `file`, default: `$id.$key.output.output`, example: `bcftools_out`. bcftools output directory
output.help_text: Type: `file`, default: `$id.$key.output.output`, example: `bcftools_out`. bcftools output directory

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
